moves.1. e4 d5: ..Scandavian....looking to not get into a Sicilian for a change and see what happens...
moves.2. exd5 Nf6: ..looking for the Icelandic Gambit. If white opens wrong it can be curtains in 10 moves...typically c4 is played by white then e6, de Bxe6, Nc3 Bb4....etc
moves.3... e6 4. Nc3 Bb4: white declines the gambit for development.
moves.5. a3 Bxc3+ 6. bxc3 Nxd5: ...Bishop is blocked now so have to look at Q side finachetto...
moves.7. Bb2 Nc6 8. c4 Nf6 9. Nf3 O-O: ...keeping the development going as will lose time finachetto'ing..White can start to untangle a bit here...
moves.10. Bd3 b6 11. O-O Bb7 12. c5 Qe7 13. cx: want to keep the place open a little ..Brings the rook into playand gives 2 open files to aim at.....
moves.13... cxb6 14. c4: White has good solid centre...rooks to the game will add to this....so with this in mind...
moves.16. Rfe1 Na5 17. Re3: ...white is now threatening to remove Nf6, and lead to a nasty attack ( i thought) of d5...with a view to Bxf6 Qxf6, Bxh7 ...with the knight Rook and Queen quickly into the Kingside...
moves.18... Kf8 19. Rc3 Bxf3: ...get rid of a key attacker...have to watch out for eventual Rh3
moves.20. Rxf3 Rxc4: get the pawn back but the rook won't be there for long....
moves.24. d5: ...i thought white needed to bring in the other rook and continue to build...this helps me get a piece into defend.
moves.24... Rxd5 25. a4: ...might be looking to anchor the bishop into b5
moves.25... Nb3 26. Rd1 Nd4: ...a4 is now  a target and the a & b pawns can eventually be nasty passed pawns.....
moves.27. Qe3 Qb4: ...making use of the bishop being loose....
moves.28. Ba3: ....nearly took the bishop.....after Bh7  Black loses straight away...
moves.28... Qxa4: ...2 pawns up but still a nasty attack for white possible.
moves.29. Ra1 Nc2: ....a nasty fork. White can't take the knight as Qxc2 is very strong for Black with Rc1 to follow. White needed to play Qc1
moves.30. Bb2: ....black now wins with the next move. As in effect material loses for white and strong passed pawns mean very strong advantage for Black...
moves.30... Qxa1+ 31. Bxa1 Nxe3: ...fxe3 and Rc1  winning the choice of bishops. Kf2 (forced) and black also has Ng4  to follow. Rxa1 is most likely.
